turn.0: ELI5: How can some "infinites" be bigger than others? Doesn't that contradict the very definition of "infinite"?
turn.1: Show that it's impossible then. You haven't given my any reason to believe you.
turn.2: If it was possible it would make sense, if it was possible, Infinite=Infinite would be true, Infinite-Infinite=0 would be true, Infinite+1=Infinite would be true and therefore 1=0 would be true.
turn.3: If infinite /= infinite, then infinite +1 /= infinite +1 and so 1 /= 1. See, I can do it too, you haven't fixed the issue.
turn.4: ...yeah  When did I give the impression that I thought it was 0? I think I said precisely the opposite
turn.5: You made the assumption in your derivation that 1 = 0 starting from inf = inf. I pointed out you made a mistake and so you didn't prove any logical fallacy.
turn.6: Uh... You do realise i can just erase that "step" and the whole thing is the exact same?
turn.7: No you can't, not without making another mistake. I've done enough derivations to see that.
turn.9: How do you get rid of the infinities on each side without subtracting?
turn.10: Subtracting one thing from one side from the other is the same as just eliminating, ignoring, its existance.
turn.11: No it's not. It's shorthand for subtracting. You made a mistake, admit it and learn from it.
turn.12: xD  Subtracting is shorthand for ignoring. You just made a mistake, admit it and learn from it.
turn.14: Sick burn but realise it's the same thing
turn.15: Sure, I admit it. I've been ignoring your dumber remarks for the sake of argument.
